chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
integrity Z multZ OZ

Premises:
integrity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Set
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
multZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => OZ | pos n => multpos x2 n | neg n => multneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Z_unitary_commutative_ring = conj Z_ring (conj multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral) : is_unitary_commutative_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ IZ oppZ
multZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => multZ x0 y = multZ y x0) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => multZ OZ y = z) eq_refl (mult_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => multZ (pos n0) y = multZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (mult_IZ y)) (fun (y0 : nat) (H : multZ (pos y0) y = multZ y (pos y0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = multZ y (pos (S y0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => addZ z y = multZ y (pos (S y0))) (eq_ind (multZ y (succZ (pos y0))) (fun z : Z => z = multZ y (pos (S y0))) eq_refl (addZ (multZ y (pos y0)) y)...
Z_ring = conj addZ_commutativity (conj Z_group (conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (_ : IdZ y) => I) (conj multZ_associativity mult_add_distributivity))) : is_ring Z IdZ addZ multZ OZ oppZ
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
multZ_eq1 : forall n : Z, multZ OZ n = OZ
mult_OZ : forall x : Z, multZ x OZ = OZ
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
tech_integ_posZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (pos n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
tech_integ_negZ : forall (n : nat) (x : Z), multZ (neg n) x = OZ -> x = OZ
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
multZ_associativity = fun x y z : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => multZ x0 (multZ y z) = multZ (multZ x0 y) z) eq_refl (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => multZ (pos n0) (multZ y z) = multZ (multZ (pos n0) y) z) eq_refl (fun (y0 : nat) (H : multZ (pos y0) (multZ y z) = multZ (multZ (pos y0) y) z) => eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => z0 = multZ (multZ (pos (S y0)) y) z) (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => addZ (multZ (pos y0) (multZ y z)) (multZ y z) = multZ z0 z) (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => addZ z0 (multZ y z) = multZ (...
mult_add_distributivity = fun x y z : Z => match x as z0 return (multZ (addZ z0 y) z = addZ (multZ z0 z) (multZ y z) /\ multZ z0 (addZ y z) = addZ (multZ z0 y) (multZ z0 z)) with | OZ => conj eq_refl eq_refl | pos n => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => multZ (addZ (pos n0) y) z = addZ (multZ (pos n0) z) (multZ y z) /\ multZ (pos n0) (addZ y z) = addZ (multZ (pos n0) y) (multZ (pos n0) z)) (conj (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => multZ z0 z = addZ (multZ (pos 0) z) (multZ y z)) (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => multZ (succZ y) z =...
addZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (add_OZ x) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ addZ OZ
multZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (eq_ind (multZ IZ x) (fun z : Z => z = x) eq_refl (multZ x IZ) (multZ_commutativity IZ x)) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ multZ IZ
posOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => pos n' end : nat -> Z Arguments posOZ _%nat_scope
negOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => neg n' end : nat -> Z Arguments negOZ _%nat_scope
Z_group = conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (H0 : IdZ y) => H0) (conj addZ_associativity (conj addZ_neutral addZ_opposite)) : is_group Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
addZ_opposite = fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj I (conj I (conj match x as z return (addZ z (oppZ z) = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_pos_negZ n | neg n => tech_add_neg_posZ n end match x as z return (addZ (oppZ z) z = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_neg_posZ n | neg n => tech_add_pos_negZ n end)) : opposite Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
simplification_integrity : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a x : S, A a -> A x -> a <> O -> Mult a x = a -> x = I
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop

```coq
Hint Resolve Z_ind Z_sind Z_rec Z_rect Z_unitary_commutative_ring addZ_associativity addZ_neutral addZ_opposite multZ_associativity multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral mult_add_distributivity tech_integ_posZ tech_integ_negZ.

intros.

unfold integrity.

rewrite <- Z_ind.

intros H_Z_ring H_multZ_commutativity H_Z_unitary_commutative_ring.

simpl.

unfold Z_ring.

rewrite <- H_Z_unitary_commutative_ring.

rewrite <- H_Z_ring.

rewrite <- H_multZ_commutativity.

auto.
Qed.```

original: Hint Resolve Z_ind Z_sind Z_rec Z_rect Z_unitary_commutative_ring addZ_associativity addZ_neutral addZ_opposite multZ_associativity multZ_commutativity multZ_neutral mult_add_distributivity tech_integ_posZ tech_integ_negZ. intros. unfold integrity. rewrite <- Z_ind. intros H_Z_ring H_multZ_commutativity H_Z_unitary_commutative_ring. simpl. unfold Z_ring. rewrite <- H_Z_unitary_commutative_ring. rewrite <- H_Z_ring. rewrite <- H_multZ_commutativity. auto.
